content: Hey, just to check: I currently do not have write access to the rust-lang/team repo. Is there a dedicated team that manages reviewing that repo that I should ping when someone wants to e.g. add a WG? or should I (as co-lead of compiler-team) simply have write access to that repo?
core team is the right team, currently, mostly as a safety precaution (since that repo gives you keys to everything)

@pnkfelix The team repo is currently only managed by the core team. I remember discussing opening the access to leads but the issue currently is that since team also provides access for services, you would also have write access to things like infra-admins.
okay then. Well Niko will be back tomorrow so I'll let them take care of this then in that case.

I think we should at some point we should split out our access structure from team. As the permissions are generally team based and don't change often while roster information is updated pretty regularly.
Yeah, that makes sense. Would be nice if leads could update their teams but not anything else.
yeah I think splitting the members from everything else is the best bet
with an automatically generated codeowners file to give limited permissions
of course, a lot of things have changed between Aug 10 and today =)
